com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus

Class RollingAbacus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus.Abacus
      • com.pb.sawdust.util.abacus.RollingAbacus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<int[]>

    public class RollingAbacus
extends Abacus
    The RollingAbacus class provides an Abacus implementation with performs multiple iteration cycles. That is, a rolling abacus constructed with parameters equivalent to a given (regular) abacus a and with a rolling count of n will have an iteration cycle equivalent to n complete cycles of a performed sequentially.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RollingAbacus

        public RollingAbacus(boolean reverse,
             long rollingCount,
             int... dimensions)
        Constructor specifying the dimensions of the abacus, its value precedence direction, and its rolling count. If the reverse flag is set to false, then a "standard" rolling abacus, where increasing array indexes indicate increasing value precedence, will be built; if reverse is set to true, then the higher the array index, the lower the value precedence.
        Parameters:
        reverse - Flag indicating whether the value precedence should be reversed or not in the abacus.
        rollingCount - The number of rollover cycles this abacus will perform.
        dimensions - The dimensions of the abacus. Each entry specifies the value at which a "rollover" occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimensions.length == 0, if any entry in dimensions is less than one, or if rollingCount < 1.

      • RollingAbacus

        public RollingAbacus(long rollingCount,
             int... dimensions)
        Constructor specifying the dimensions of the abacus and its rolling count. An "standard" (non-reversed) abacus will be constructed.
        Parameters:
        rollingCount - The number of rollover cycles this abacus will perform.
        dimensions - The dimensions of the abacus. Each entry specifies the value at which a "rollover" occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimensions.length == 0, if any entry in dimensions is less than one, or if rollingCount < 1.

    • Method Detail

      • freshClone

        public RollingAbacus freshClone()
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Get a new abacus with the same structure as this one set at its first positional state. This method does not affect this abacus.
        Overrides:
        freshClone in class Abacus
        Returns:
        a new clone of this abacus with its position state set to that in which now iterations have been performed.

      • getAbacusPoint

        public int[] getAbacusPoint(long iteratorPosition)
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Get the array returned by this abacus after a given number of iterations. This method is more efficient than explicitly iterating through a fresh clone of this abacus, and thus can be useful in quickly getting a single position in this abacus's iteration cycle.
        Overrides:
        getAbacusPoint in class Abacus
        Parameters:
        iteratorPosition - The iteration position of interest.
        Returns:
        the abacus point at iterationPosition.

      • setAbacusAtPosition

        public void setAbacusAtPosition(long iteratorPosition)
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Set this abacus's state to that which it would have after a given number of iterations. The iterator position argument refers to the number of iterations on a fresh clone, not the current state of this abacus.
        Overrides:
        setAbacusAtPosition in class Abacus
        Parameters:
        iteratorPosition - The position to set this abacus at.

      • setAbacusPoint

        public void setAbacusPoint(int[] point)
        Description copied from class: Abacus

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Description copied from class: Abacus
        Get the total number of times this abacus can be iterated. That is, the number of times next() can be called on a fresh clone of this abacus before hasNext() returns false.
        Overrides:
        getLength in class Abacus
        Returns:
        the number of times this abacus can be iterated.
